intro: Humboltia klotzschiana, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its large, white, fragrant flowers that open at night. The plant is a shrub or small tree, typically reaching heights of up to 5 meters, with smooth, grayish bark and oval-shaped leaves. Its flowers are tubular and bloom in clusters, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, round seeds.
